page.title: 14Gravel Extraction
page.content: We visited a quarry owned by{Hall {Aggregates}because it was the only industry in our area. The plant is situated along the{River Blackwater. The processing plant is connected to the extraction area by a thousand feet long conveyer belt. The gravel is extracted for building materials such as concrete and cement.{A dragline {crane}removes the top soil and peat revealing a layer of gravel. Compact {fossilized wood}was found inbetween the layers of peat and gravel. It was possibly{10,000 years old.}The gravel is scooped up and put into a hopper which transfers it to the conveyer belt. When it reaches the processing plant the gravel is washed and graded into different sizes. Oversized pieces are crushed to a useful size. The residue of sand and water is pumped into piles to dry ready for use.
